channel.title: RSS Feed
channel.description: My experiences of being a software engineer.

item.title: Algorithms and data structures: Binary search tree inorder traversal
item.description: Given a binary search tree, return the inorder traversal of its nodes values.

item.title: Algorithms and data structures: Fuel Stations
item.description: There are N fuel stations along a circular route, where the amount of fuel at station i is A[i] and it cost B[i] in fuel to get to the next station. Where should I start my journey if I want to travel the full circular route?

item.title: Teaching Technology Tips and Tricks
item.description: A recent Tweet from Josh W. Comeau got me thinking more about how to teach technical subjects like programming more effectively. Here is a list of tips and tricks from his summary and more.

item.title: JavaScript try/catch/finally error handling
item.description: I recently encountered a bug that used try/catch blocks to prevent propagating errors when DOM queries failed. The try/catch/finally combo is not exactly intuitive.

item.title: Flux Insurance Company
item.description: Flux is the application architecture that Facebook uses for building client-side web applications. Redux is a popular JavaScript implementation of the Flux pattern. This pattern can be explained through the analogy of an insurance company.

item.title: Understanding internal, external, and inline CSS
item.description: There are three main techniques to load Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) in your HTML pages; internal, external, and inline. Performance and maintainability, among other factors, can be impacted by your approach so choose wisely.

item.title: Side project: Bowhead
item.description: Bowhead is a boilerplate project for fast micro-saas prototyping using Google's Firebase platform for authentication and data storage, ReactJS for UI, and Stripe for subscription payment processing.

item.title: Algorithm and data structures: Two Sum
item.description: Given an array of integers and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

item.title: Deterministic sorting
item.description: When using Array.sort() make sure your comparator function is deterministic. It should always return the same value for the same inputs, even if the argument order changes.

item.title: Side project: Orca
item.description: A Command-Line Interface (CLI) is a way to interact with a program installed on a computer through a terminal interface. Typically these programs receive input via lines of text and will run processes based on this input.

item.title: Deterministic vs. Pure functions
item.description: All pure functions are deterministic, but not all deterministic functions are pure. Pure functions are easier to reason about and test, you should aim to implement pure functions.

item.title: Side project: AC Visitor Center
item.description: AC Visitor Center is a queue manager using ReactJS and Firebase created to solve a problem I had in a video game. It allows for a secret code to be securely exposed to the first person in a queue.

item.title: What is DX?
item.description: DX is the user experience from a developer's perspective when using a product or service such as client libraries, APIs, SDKs, frameworks, and other developer tools.
